name: APRS to Twitter Gateway Server
body:
### Installation of the server software.
This software depends on ruby, and the twitter gem. 
Install these before continuing.

The following assumes the use of a debian based distro.

```
$ apt-get install ruby
$ apt-get install rubygems
$ gem install twitter
```

Once completed you'll want to clone the software (or just download and extract it from the links in the header).

```
$ git clone https://github.com/KR0SIV/APRS-to-Twitter-Gateway.git
$ cd APRS-to-Twitter-Gateway
```

### Edit the configuration
At this time there is no config file, you'll need to edit the following lines to get the software up and running.
Starting on line 70 edit the Twitter key details to match the API keys for your twitter account
Example: (keys are fake here, don't bother trying to copy this key set)

```
  config.consumer_key        = "156Chgp0Ut12345NxNl4565Nu"
  config.consumer_secret     = "XFUCEhY2eYffx1MT2zow123456789N9JguyvB01BmOP1Cvq9fg"
  config.access_token        = "2791234567-C8eyvcoim48568qqCm27v3F1234567zGkP7pE4Tww"
  config.access_token_secret = "r9thBpZP1112345sGX2bjN8GgQKg123457h9X4tqT8XgK"
```

### Configure APRS details
The majority of this has been done for you however you need to make a few changes.
Starting on line 77
Please replace callsign_here with your callsign, the message on connection and your coordinates should be used, not mine.

```
  aprs = Aprs.new("second.aprs.net", 20157, "Callsign_here")
  aprs.connect
  aprs.packet("=4148.19N/08056.81W-", "Any_Message_Here")
```
